009package imagingbook.pub.geometry.hulls;
010
011import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Collection;
014
015import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Segment;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.hull.ConvexHull2D;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.hull.MonotoneChain;
019
020import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
022
023/**
024 * This class serves to calculate the convex hull of a binary region
025 * or a closed contour, given as a sequence of point coordinates.
026 * It is based on the convex hull implementation provided by the
027 * Apache Commons Math library, in particular the classes 
028 * {@link ConvexHull2D} and {@link MonotoneChain}.
029 * 
030 * @author W. Burger
031 * @version 2020/10/11
032 */
033public class ConvexHull {
034        
035        private final ConvexHull2D hull;
036        
037        // public constructors ------------------------
038        
039        public ConvexHull(Iterable<Pnt2d> iterable) {
040                this.hull = new MonotoneChain().generate(convertToVector2D(iterable));
041        }
042        
043        // public methods ------------------------
044        
045        public Pnt2d[] getVertices() {
046                Vector2D[] vecs = hull.getVertices();   // apparently vertices are ordered, but is this guaranteed?
047                Pnt2d[] pnts = new Pnt2d[vecs.length];
048                for (int i = 0; i < vecs.length; i++) {
049                        pnts[i] = PntDouble.from(vecs[i]);
050                }
051                return pnts;
052        }
053        
054        public Line2D[] getSegments() {
055                Segment[] origSegments = hull.getLineSegments();
056                Line2D[] newSegments = new Line2D.Double[origSegments.length];
057                for (int i = 0; i < origSegments.length; i++) {
058                        Segment seg = origSegments[i];
059                        Vector2D start = seg.getStart();
060                        Vector2D end = seg.getEnd();
061                        newSegments[i] = new Line2D.Double(start.getX(), start.getY(), end.getX(), end.getY());
062                }
063                return newSegments;
064        }
065        
066        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
067        
068        private Collection<Vector2D> convertToVector2D(Iterable<Pnt2d> iterable) {
069                Collection<Vector2D> vecs = new ArrayList<Vector2D>();
070                for (Pnt2d p : iterable) {
071                        vecs.add(new Vector2D(p.getX(), p.getY()));
072                }
073                return vecs;
074        }
075
076}
